result.execSummary:
The defendant Kothar C Bishop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kothar C Bishop

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Theft, Co. Ord. 63.042 to which defendant pled no contest.
Court found defendant guilty and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $75.00 including all costs and surcharges by 8/17/22.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-19-2022, filed.  rmm

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Kothar C Bishop not in court, in custody.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Defendant has a pending revocation and Atty. Poznanski requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick and Save, 1735 W Silver Spring Dr.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Kothar C Bishop in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Kothar C Bishop in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kothar C Bishop appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.  Case remains calendar for Pre-Trial Conference on April 4. 2022 at 09:00 This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Kothar C Bishop not in court.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear for booking on 3-16-2022 by 5:00pm, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued, REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. 
Court further orders that any bail on deposit be forfeited. Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at the close of the case.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (3/16/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick and Save located at 1735 W SilverSpring Drive
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kothar C Bishop in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br.01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/14/22 @ 2:30p
